node.name: unlink - remove one link to a file
node.description:
Deletes a list of files. Returns the number of files successfully deleted. 

    $cnt = unlink 'a', 'b', 'c';
    unlink @goners;
    unlink <*.bak>;

Note: [perlfunc:unlink|unlink()] will not delete directories unless you are superuser and the -U flag is supplied to Perl. Even if these conditions are met, be warned that unlinking a directory can inflict damage on your filesystem. Use [perlfunc:rmdir|rmdir()] instead.

If LIST is omitted, uses $_.
node.title: perlfunc:unlink
